name: Ncat
description: Ncat, also known as Netcat, is a versatile networking utility used for reading from and writing to network connections using the TCP/IP protocol. It is designed to be a reliable back-end tool that can be used directly or easily driven by other programs and scripts. Ncat can function as a server or client, making it useful for a variety of applications including debugging, network exploration, and as a communication tool. Its capabilities make it well-suited for testing and development. It also is popularly used in security contexts for port scanning, transferring files, and port listening operations.
